title: Helm of speed
data:
| \[ [![Plumed helmet.png](/images/4/4b/Plumed_helmet.png)](/wiki/File:Plumed_helmet.png)   \[ [![Etched helmet.png](/images/3/33/Etched_helmet.png)](/wiki/File:Etched_helmet.png)   \[ [![Crested helmet.png](/images/8/8a/Crested_helmet.png)](/wiki/File:Crested_helmet.png)   \[ [![Visored helmet.png](/images/b/bc/Visored_helmet.png)](/wiki/File:Visored_helmet.png)***helm of speed |                                                               |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Appearance                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                               |
| Slot                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm")                                     |
| AC                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [1](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")                          |
| Special                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | speed                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                               |
| Base price                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | 50 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                              |
| Weight                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [50](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                   |
| Material                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal")                                  |

The **helm of speed** is a type of magical [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). Its default material is [steel](/wiki/Steel "Steel"), and it provides very fast [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") when worn. It has a [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance"), and the default one associated with it is a winged helmet.

## Generation

The [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") prize armor has a 1⁄2 chance of being a helm of speed.

[Player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [centaurs](/index.php?title=Centaur_\(monster_attribute\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Centaur (monster attribute) (page does not exist)") and [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(monster_attribute\) "Giant (monster attribute)") generated at level 20 will have a helm of speed, and two different kits for other level 20 player monsters include a helm of speed.

## Description

While worn, the helm of speed grants 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and very fast [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed").

## Strategy

The helm is designed to provide a source of speed for player centaurs and [tortles](/wiki/Tortle_\(starting_race\) "Tortle (starting race)"), who cannot wear [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") of any kind. Tortles have the additional trade-off of gaining very fast speed in return for more difficulty retreating into their shell via [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") (or the [shell](/index.php?title=Shell_\(technique\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shell (technique) (page does not exist)") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") in Hack'EM). Players of other species can use this helm to free up their boots slot, e.g. for [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots").

A [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone") or [stone](/wiki/Stone "Stone") helm of speed can be a viable [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for spellcasters that either lack a slot for boots or else want that slot free, while a [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril") helm of speed may be a similarly preferable wish for non-casters.

Helm of speed

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
[    [    [    [ 
helm of speed
Appearance random
Slot helm
AC 1
Special speed
Base price 50 zm
Weight 50
Material metal

The helm of speed is a type of magical helm that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. Its default material is steel, and it provides very fast speed when worn. It has a randomized appearance, and the default one associated with it is a winged helmet.

Generation

The Sokoban prize armor has a 1⁄2 chance of being a helm of speed.

Player monster centaurs and giants generated at level 20 will have a helm of speed, and two different kits for other level 20 player monsters include a helm of speed.

Description

While worn, the helm of speed grants 1 base AC and very fast speed.

Strategy

The helm is designed to provide a source of speed for player centaurs and tortles, who cannot wear boots of any kind. Tortles have the additional trade-off of gaining very fast speed in return for more difficulty retreating into their shell via #monster (or the shell technique in Hack'EM). Players of other species can use this helm to free up their boots slot, e.g. for water walking boots.

A bone or stone helm of speed can be a viable wish for spellcasters that either lack a slot for boots or else want that slot free, while a mithril helm of speed may be a similarly preferable wish for non-casters.

The '''helm of speed''' is a type of magical [[helm]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. Its default material is [[steel]], and it provides very fast [[speed]] when worn. It has a [[randomized appearance]], and the default one associated with it is a winged helmet.

==Generation==
The [[Sokoban]] prize armor has a {{frac|2}} chance of being a helm of speed.

[[Player monster]] [[Centaur (monster attribute)|centaurs]] and [[Giant (monster attribute)|giants]] generated at level 20 will have a helm of speed, and two different kits for other level 20 player monsters include a helm of speed.

==Description==
While worn, the helm of speed grants 1 base [[AC]] and very fast [[speed]].

==Strategy==
The helm is designed to provide a source of speed for player centaurs and [[Tortle (starting race)|tortles]], who cannot wear [[boots]] of any kind. Tortles have the additional trade-off of gaining very fast speed in return for more difficulty retreating into their shell via [[Monster (command)|#monster]] (or the [[Shell (technique)|shell]] [[technique]] in Hack'EM). Players of other species can use this helm to free up their boots slot, e.g. for [[water walking boots]].

A [[bone]] or [[stone]] helm of speed can be a viable [[wish]] for spellcasters that either lack a slot for boots or else want that slot free, while a [[mithril]] helm of speed may be a similarly preferable wish for non-casters.
